discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Page Setup in Tableau Desktop allows you to control various printing options

questions.question_text:
You create a worksheet named Sales by Region and hide the title of the worksheet.

You print the worksheet as a PDF and notice that the worksheet title appears.

You need to prevent the title from appearing when you print the worksheet as a PDF.

Which settings should configure from the File menu in Tableau Desktop?

You create the following story that contains two story point.

//IMG//


You want to change the story point format to show the current story point number out of the total number of story points.

Which Layout option should you use?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
To change the story point format to show the current story point number out of the total number of story points. ex: if you are in 2 story point out of 5 story point. the 
ARROWS ONLY display < 2/5 >

Selected Answer: D
Going for D. My final choice

Selected Answer: B
I have voted B.
However D-Arrows only seems to be right as well as it shows 2/7 if you are in story point 2 out of 7 story point

Selected Answer: B
Numbers layout allows you to display the current story point number within the overall sequence.

Selected Answer: C
I think it should be caption boxes where we can edit the store points

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP
-

In a worksheet, you have a calculated column named YTD Sales that uses the following formula.

[Order Date] <= TODAY() AND DATETRUNC( "year", [Order Date]) = DATETRUNC("year", TODAY())

You want to create a calculated column named Exclude Current Month that will be dragged to the Filters shelf. Exclude Current Month will exclude the current month values from YTD Sales.

How should you complete the formula for Exclude Current Month? (Drag the appropriate Options to the Answer Area and drop into the correct locations.)

//IMG//

discussion.content:
Filter the current month of current year
So Datediff("month",order_date,today())>0 and datediff("year",order_date,today())=0
